sub_title: P2P Coupa System Administrator at CRH
summary:
I am a professional focusing on providing customers and vendors the best experience in the industry. 
My knowledge of the procurement and customer service world is huge where I have learned to and I have built strong relationships along the way in my career with customers, colleagues, project 
groups, vendors, distributors and other stake holders. 
My expertise are in the areas of writing procedures, training & coaching employees, Reporting & Analysis, Coupa Admin and Functional Consultant, Project Management, Global Procurement P2P, Global E2E Process Improvement, Integration execution and SAP System SD, WM, PM, BW and MDM knowledge. 
The industries that I have worked with are mainly IT Software & Devices, Drinks, Medical Devices, 
Pharmaceutical, Dairy and Waste management/Renewables. My interest would be to improve the business processes either in one of 
these industries but I am open to getting to learn about other industries as well. 
My strengths are highly motivated, ability to identify improvement areas in the business, strong team player with excellent communication & social skills, strong analytical and problem-solving skills and fast learner with ability to process info efficiently.

profile_positions.title: P2P Coupa System Administrator

profile_positions.description: Design, Implementation & Maintenance of Coupa spend management system (P2P). Administer and maintain the technical implementation of the Coupa tool implementation for the Business regions as well as coordinate supplier enablement activities.
profile_positions.title: IT Project & Application Manager P2P
Coupa - Application Services Consultant at Renewi Nederland

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities handled:
Project Fix the Basics: Leading Material Masterdata cleansing for plants on lead-time, min. order qty etc. Alignment with production/logistics dept and corporate procurement on vendor agreement. Initiating of training needs for location on MRP system data usage. Presenting analysis to procurement management team and suggesting strategic improvement methods.
Project Material Contingency: Made an overview of raw materials on BOM levels, where it is used and backup plan for supply in case of unexpected demand increase/decrease. Analysed the Spend list for plant to realize cost reduction strategy with plant management.
Project Coupa* Implementation: The scope was on Indirect materials. Masterdata cleanup and readiness. Identifying & deciding on the CSG-Category Source Group based on SAP procurement blue-prints for new vendors from legacy system.  Deciding on content type for each vendor (web-form, punch-out, catalogue or free-text. For some on invoicing through cXML). Liaison with vendors on price for services or material etc. Dashboard updates provided weekly on project progress.

Projects: Fix the Basics and Coupa Implementation.
profile_positions.title: Business Procurement Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities handled:
Project SUMMIT – Ingredients Plant Maintenance: Managed the SAP Implementation of Purchase to Pay (P2P) Vendor & Spare-parts for 5 Ingredients Maintenance Plant/Warehouse. Through the Stage-Gate method, I was involved on all phases. Validation Phase - Analysing Master-data on Vendors/Spare Parts.  Identifying & aligning Procurement Preferred Vendors with plant/maintenance managers. (approx. 3.5K vendors). Onboarding of vendors. Data Cleansing of Vendor/Spare parts file (approx. 42K Spare-parts across 5 plants). Prepared vendor and materials file for master-data upload for the UAT - User Acceptance Testing. Keeping all stakeholders up to date on project progress and having weekly meetings on status and issues and making sure we are on budget & schedule. For Meppel, 10K spare-parts vendor material pricing completed, participated in stock count and uploaded successfully for Go-live (5/Dec/2018). For Borculo, 21K spare-parts vendor material pricing completed, participated in stock count and uploaded successfully for Go-live (6/May/2019).

Trainings attended: SAP Validation.
Project: SUMMIT-IngredientsW2(T14)-Plant Maintenance
profile_positions.title: Business Consultant P2P Ingredients Maintenance

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities handled:
P2P Vendor Invoice Mismatch Resolution (IMR) via Basware system. Approving invoices after checks are done. Analysing mismatch and identifying the problem area’s and finding solution for better flow of E-invoicing/EDI process. Liaising with Vendors/Buyers/Category Procurement Managers to have better ways of working in-line with our Centre of Excellence (CoE) journey. Close liaison with Vendor Master data team and Global Master Data team for any correction on vendor accounts. Making sure price mismatches are corrected by Contracts Pricing team. Update Share Point Site for Pricing list from Category Procurement. Working on multiple SAP system versions 400, 500 & 600 across all locations.
Trainings attended: Prima, Coupa.
profile_positions.title: Vendor & Contracts Management Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities handled:
Managed 9 CS teams in EMEAI. Developed & Implemented, monthly Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), Back Order report for EMEAI on SAP Query tools, Customer Satisfaction Survey Program, training program for new and existing employees in EMEA region. Provided training for new process and procedures. Created, maintained and implemented Standard Operating Procedures (SOP). Implemented improvements of the order to cash (OTC) process like EDI and E-Invoicing. RASCI matrix lead for EMEAI. Back-up for CS Contracts & Pricing Administrator. Implemented and managed CS EMEA Share Point site to share Best Practices with the teams. Point of escalation for CS team on access request for SAP and system tools. Monthly con-calls with EMEAI CS Supervisors and Country Managers/Directors.

Projects: CS EMEAI Excellence, Cost to Serve, Customer Consignment & Global Integration.
Trainings attended: Giving and Receiving Feedback, Change Management & Microsoft Excel 2010.
profile_positions.title: Manager CS EMEAI

profile_positions.description:
Position (2) - IT Support Europe
Duration Oct 2012 – end March 2013

Responsibilities handled for IT Support Europe:
Using the ITIL way of working, registration on Active-X Directory system. IT installation for users – Desktops, Laptops & IPads. Adding/removing users in system – new and existing users. Helping users on requests logged in through IT HelpDesk system. Fixing printing issues in warehouse for label printing and others. Fixing handheld scanner issues. Making system server back-ups at the end of the day.
Projects completed: IT Extranet Implementation for Europe. 

Position (1) -Customer Service Representative UK
Duration Mid Feb 2011 – Oct 2012

Responsibilities handled for Customer Service Representative UK:
Order management activities. Portfolio Management of all codes for the UK market and making sure that tender/contract/catalogue pricing was applied accordingly for the customers. Tender management, checking through the tender sites and bidding for the products that were able to be supplied. Reporting and analysis, prepared monthly KPI report. SOX compliance reporting. Weekly/monthly calls with Commercial team and US Team on planning/forecast. Implementation of EDI for UK, France, Spain, Germany and Italy.

Projects completed: EDI (Electronic Data Interchange), Move to the new location - Moving Team, Mentoring/Coaching Training of CS colleagues and Return’s Process for CS.
Training attended: Product Training Basic & Advance and SAP Training Advance.
profile_positions.title: IT Support Europe & CS Rep UK

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities handled:
Order management activities. Forecasting, liaising with demand planning team. Portfolio Management of all sku’s for individual markets. Analysing reports from SAP into Excel.  Having weekly/monthly calls with Commercial team and Customers on planning/forecast. Liaising daily/weekly with Customers, Direct Export (DX), In Market Companies, Commercial Manager, Quality Department, Demand Planner, Warehouse and shipper.

Training attended: Microsoft Excel 2007 Advance.
profile_positions.title: Customer Service Specialist DX

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities handled:
Order management activities. Forecasting for customers and liaising with demand planning team. Portfolio Management of all sku’s for individual markets. Handling Customer concerns (CC) with CC team in supply sites. Head of Team Billing, ensured reduced number of open orders at every month-end, year-end with accordance to the KPI measurement targets. SUPERUSER for GRNI- Goods Received Not Invoiced. Set up the Bulk order process with Baileys and 3rd party customer. Trained new colleagues on Order management. Markets handled Europe & Asia.

Projects completed: OLV (Order Lifecycle Visibility) Tool & Global Process Mapping.
Trainings attended: Supply Chain Management, Freight Management (Incoterms), Credit Management & SAP.
profile_positions.title: SMR OPS COORDINATOR
